Raval</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Presentation talks about introduction to MITRE ATT&amp;CK Framework, different use cases, pitfalls to take care about.. Talk was delivered @Null Bangalore and @OWASP Bangalore chapter on 15th February 2019.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R11c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R11c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-1" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R12c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R12c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R12c9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/leveraging-mitre-attck-speaking-the-common-language/150494688"><span class="sr-only">Leveraging MITRE ATT&amp;CK - Speaking the Common Language</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:1" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Leveraging MITRE ATT&amp;CK - Speaking the Common Language" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/sec599-june2019-sansfire-attck-190619015701-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Leveraging MITRE ATT&amp;CK - Speaking the Common Language" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/sec599-june2019-sansfire-attck-190619015701-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Leveraging MITRE ATT&amp;CK - Speaking the Common Language</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Leveraging MITRE ATT&amp;CK - Speaking the Common Language for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd2c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd2c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd2c9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd2c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd2c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/erikvanbuggenhout">Erik Van Buggenhout</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">MITRE ATT&amp;CK is quickly gaining traction and is becoming an important standard to use to assess the overall cyber security posture of an organization. Tools like ATT&amp;CK Navigator facilitate corporate adoption and allow for a holistic overview on attack techniques and how the organization is preventing and detecting them. Furthermore, many vendors, technologies and open-source initiatives are aligning with ATT&amp;CK. Join Erik Van Buggenhout in this presentation, where he will discuss how MITRE ATT&amp;CK can be leveraged in the organization as part of your overall cyber security program, with a focus on adversary emulation.

Erik Van Buggenhout is the lead author of SANS SEC599 - Defeating Advanced Adversaries - Purple Team Tactics &amp; Kill Chain Defenses. Next to his activities at SANS, Erik is also a co-founder of NVISO, a European cyber security firm with offices in Brussels, Frankfurt and Munich.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R12c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R12c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R13c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R13c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R13c9jnf6"><a Protection Beyond Alerting</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Proactive Threat Hunting: Game-Changing Endpoint Protection Beyond Alerting</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Proactive Threat Hunting: Game-Changing Endpoint Protection Beyond Alerting for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd3c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd3c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd3c9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd3c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd3c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Falcon OverWatch Experts Hunt 24/7 To Stop Incidents Before They Become Breaches

Is your IT security team suffering from alert fatigue? For many organizations, chasing down every security alert can tax an already overburdened IT department, often resulting in a breach that might have been avoided. Adding to this challenge is an increase in sophisticated threats that strike so fast and frequently, traditional methods of investigation and response can’t offer adequate protection. 

A new webcast from CrowdStrike, “Proactive Threat Hunting: Game-Changing Endpoint Protection Above and Beyond Alerting,” discusses why so many organizations are vulnerable to unseen threats and alert fatigue, and why having an approach that is both reactive and proactive is key. You’ll also learn about Falcon OverWatch™, CrowdStrike’s proactive threat hunting service that investigates and responds to threats immediately, dramatically increasing your ability to react before a damaging breach occurs.

Download the webcast slides to learn:

--How constantly reacting to alerts prevents you from getting ahead of the potentially damaging threats designed to bypass standard endpoint security
--Why an approach that includes  proactive threat hunting, sometimes called Managed Detection and Response, is key to increasing protection against new and advanced threats   
--How CrowdStrike Falcon OverWatch can provide 24/7 managed threat hunting, augmenting your security efforts with a team of cyber intrusion detection analysts and investigators who proactively identify and prioritize incidents before they become damaging breaches
</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R13c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R13c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime MITRE ATT&amp;CK: Enhancing Operations Through the Tracking of Interac... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd5c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd5c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd5c9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd5c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd5c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MITREATTACK">MITRE ATT&amp;CK</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">From ATT&amp;CKcon 3.0

By Jason Wood and Justin Swisher, CrowdStrike

When it comes to understanding and tracking intrusion tradecraft, security teams must have the tools and processes that allow the mapping of hands-on adversary tradecraft. Doing this enables your team to both understand the adversaries and attacks you currently see and observe how these adversaries and attacks evolve over time. This session will explore how a threat hunting team uses MITRE ATT&amp;CK to understand and categorize adversary activity. The team will demonstrate how threat hunters map ATT&amp;CK TTPs by showcasing a recent interactive intrusion against a Linux endpoint and how the framework allowed for granular tracking of tradecraft and enhanced security operations. They will also take a look into the changes in the Linux activity they have observed over time, using the ATT&amp;CK navigator to compare and contrast technique usage. This session will provide insights into how we use MITRE ATT&amp;CK as a powerful resource to track intrusion tradecraft, identify adversary trends, and prepare for attacks of the future.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R15c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R15c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf for Improving Security Posture in Orga...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:5" Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Adversary Emulation and Its Importance for Improving Security Posture in Orga... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd6c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd6c9jnf6:" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd6c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd6c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/digitoktavianto">Digit Oktavianto</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses adversary emulation and its importance for improving security posture. It begins with an introduction to adversary emulation, comparing it to simulation. Adversary emulation involves closely mimicking the actual tactics, techniques, and procedures of a known adversary based on threat intelligence. The document outlines the benefits of adversary emulation, such as helping organizations test their defenses against the latest real-world threats. It also provides guidance on developing an adversary emulation plan, including researching a specific adversary and modeling their behaviors to design scenario-based tests that are executed sequentially.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R16c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R16c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-6" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R17c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R17c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R17c9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/cyber-threat-intelligence-47523086/47523086"><span class="sr-only">Cyber Threat Intelligence</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:6" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Cyber Threat Intelligence" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/bigsecuritydata-150428120541-conversion-gate02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Cyber Threat Intelligence" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/bigsecuritydata-150428120541-conversion-gate02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Cyber Threat Intelligence</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Cyber Threat Intelligence for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd7c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd7c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd7c9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd7c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd7c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/trialgtun">mohamed nasri</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses cyber threat intelligence and strategies for defense. It begins with an introduction to cyber threat intelligence and discusses the cyber attack life cycle model from Lockheed Martin. It then addresses questions to consider regarding cyber threats. The document outlines threat intelligence standards and tools like STIX and TAXII, and discusses challenges with SIEM systems. It proposes architectures that incorporate threat intelligence to provide preventive, detective, and fusion capabilities. The presentation concludes with a discussion of data sources and architectures to support cyber threat analysis.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R17c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R17c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-7" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R18c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R18c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R18c9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/what-is-attck-coverage-anyway-breadth-and-depth-analysis-with-atomic-red-team/251521611"><span class="sr-only">What is ATT&amp;CK coverage, anyway? Breadth and depth analysis with Atomic Red Team</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:7" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="What is ATT&amp;CK coverage, anyway? Breadth and depth analysis with Atomic Red Team" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/whatisattckcoverageanyway-220406003027-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="What is ATT&amp;CK coverage, anyway? Breadth and depth analysis with Atomic Red Team" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/whatisattckcoverageanyway-220406003027-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">What is ATT&amp;CK coverage, anyway? Breadth and depth analysis with Atomic Red Team</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save What is ATT&amp;CK coverage, anyway? Breadth and depth analysis with Atomic Red Team for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd8c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd8c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd8c9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd8c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd8c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MITREATTACK">MITRE ATT&amp;CK</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">From ATT&amp;CKcon 3.0

By Brian Donohue, Red Canary

This presentation will highlight the Atomic Red Team project&#x27;s efforts to define and increase the test coverage of MITRE ATT&amp;CK techniques. We&#x27;ll describe the challenges we encountered in defining what &quot;coverage&quot; means in the context of an ATT&amp;CK-based framework, and how to use that definition to improve an open source project that&#x27;s used by a diverse audience of practitioners to satisfy an equally diverse array of needs. The audience will learn how the Atomic Red Team maintainers standardize and categorize atomic tests, perform gap analysis to achieve deep technique-level coverage and broad matrix-level coverage, and quickly fill those gaps with new tests.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R18c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R18c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-8" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R19c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R19c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R19c9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/attcking-with-threat-intelligence/107919736"><span class="sr-only">ATT&amp;CKing with Threat Intelligence</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:8" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="ATT&amp;CKing with Threat Intelligence" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/hopemitre-180729235258-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="ATT&amp;CKing with Threat Intelligence" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/hopemitre-180729235258-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">ATT&amp;CKing with Threat Intelligence</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save ATT&amp;CKing with Threat Intelligence for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd9c9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd9c9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd9c9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd9c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd9c9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ChristopherKorban">Christopher Korban</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">MITRE’s ATT&amp;CK is a community-driven knowledge base and model for cyber adversary behavior, reflecting the various phases of an adversary’s life cycle and the platforms they are known to target. By scoping the wide breadth of the MITRE ATT&amp;CK matrix to focus initially on the techniques used by threat actors you specifically care about, you can help the defenders create more useful and impactful detections first. Once you start emulating the appropriate threat actors, you can practice your defenses in a scenario that’s more realistic and applicable without the need for an actual intrusion. The speakers are providing a process and a case study of APT3 - a China-based threat group - for how to go from finding threat intelligence, sifting through it for actionable techniques, creating emulation plans, discovering how to emulate different techniques... to actually operating on a network. They are also providing a beginning &quot;cheat sheet&quot; for this actor to give a starting point for red and blue teams to accomplish these techniques in their own environment without the need to build their own tooling.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R19c9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R19c9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ac9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R1ac9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ac9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/using-mitre-preattck-and-attck-in-cybercrime-education-and-research/241296402"><span class="sr-only">Using MITRE PRE-ATTACK and ATTACK in Cybercrime Education and Research</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Using MITRE PRE-ATTACK and ATTACK in Cybercrime Education and Research" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/aunshulrege-210113194534-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Using MITRE PRE-ATTACK and ATTACK in Cybercrime Education and Research" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/aunshulrege-210113194534-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Using MITRE PRE-ATTACK and ATTACK in Cybercrime Education and Research</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Using MITRE PRE-ATTACK and ATTACK in Cybercrime Education and Research for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdac9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdac9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdac9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdac9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdac9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/attackcon2018">MITRE - ATT&amp;CKcon</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">From MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon Power Hour October 2020

By:
Aunshul Rege, Associate Professor, Temple University, @prof_rege

Rachel Bleiman, PhD Student/NSF Graduate Research Assistant, Temple University, @rab1928

This presentation from the MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon Power Hour session on October 9, 2020, explores the application of the MITRE ATT&amp;CK® and PRE-ATT&amp;CK matrices in cybercrime education and research. Specifically, Rege and Bleiman demonstrate the mapping of the PRE-ATT&amp;CK matrix to social engineering case studies as an experiential learning project in an upper-level cybercrime liberal arts course. It thus allows students to understand the alignment process of threat intelligence to the PRE-ATT&amp;CK framework and also learn about its usefulness/limitations. The talk also discusses the mapping of the ATT&amp;CK matrix, tactics, techniques, software, and groups for two cybercrime datasets created by collating publicly disclosed incidents: (i) critical infrastructure ransomware (CIRW) incidents, and (ii) social engineering (SE) incidents. For the CIRW dataset, 39% of the strains mapped onto the ATT&amp;CK software. For the SE dataset, 49% of the groups and 65% of the techniques map on to the MITRE framework. This helps the researchers identify the framework&#x27;s usefulness/limitations and also helps our datasets connect to richer information that may not otherwise be available in the publicly disclosed incidents.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ac9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ac9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-10" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1bc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R1bc9jnf6:" SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Adversary Emulation - Red Team Village - Mayhem 2020 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbddc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbddc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbddc9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbddc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbddc9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/jorgeorchilles">Jorge Orchilles</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jorge Orchilles is an experienced red team leader who has led offensive security assessments for large financial institutions. The document discusses adversary emulation, which involves the red team emulating realistic adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures to obtain access to an organization. This helps evaluate an organization&#x27;s preparedness against sophisticated attacks. It describes measuring how people, processes, and technologies prevent or detect the red team&#x27;s activities to identify areas for improvement.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1dc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1dc9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-13" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ec9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R1ec9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ec9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/knowledge-for-the-masses-storytelling-with-attck/251521610"><span class="sr-only">Knowledge for the masses: Storytelling with ATT&amp;CK</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:13" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Knowledge for the masses: Storytelling with ATT&amp;CK</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Knowledge for the masses: Storytelling with ATT&amp;CK for later" class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdec9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdec9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MITREATTACK">MITRE ATT&amp;CK</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses using storytelling to increase understanding of cyber threats through ATT&amp;CK threat sightings. It describes the AC3 methodology for documenting threat actor tactics, techniques, and procedures with full context and observables. Different levels of abstraction and tools are used to translate threat sightings into various formats to ensure understanding across audiences. Maintaining defensive playbooks adapted from threat sightings helps continuous understanding and improvement of defenses.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ec9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ec9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1fc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R1fc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1fc9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/no-easy-breach-derby-con-2016/66447908"><span style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">No Easy Breach DerbyCon 2016</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save No Easy Breach DerbyCon 2016 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdfc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdfc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdfc9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdfc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdfc9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MatthewDunwoody1">Matthew Dunwoody</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Every IR presents unique challenges. But - when an attacker uses PowerShell, WMI, Kerberos attacks, novel persistence mechanisms, seemingly unlimited C2 infrastructure and half-a-dozen rapidly-evolving malware families across a 100k node network to compromise the environment at a rate of 10 systems per day - the cumulative challenges can become overwhelming. This talk will showcase the obstacles overcome during one of the largest and most advanced breaches Mandiant has ever responded to, the novel investigative techniques employed, and the lessons learned that allowed us to help remediate it.

Details a massive intrusion by Russian APT29 (AKA CozyDuke, Cozy Bear)</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1fc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1fc9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div [TM]</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Overview of the Cyber Kill Chain [TM] for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdgc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdgc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdgc9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdgc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdgc9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/dgsweigert">David Sweigert</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">William F. Crowe presented on the cybersecurity kill chain, which models the stages of a cyber attack based on military doctrine. The model developed by Lockheed Martin includes stages of reconnaissance, weaponization, delivery, exploitation, installation, command and control, and actions on objectives. ISACA and the European Union Agency for Network and Information Security also use similar kill chain models to analyze the process of advanced persistent threats targeting critical systems and data.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1gc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1gc9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime ATT&amp;CK</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Tracking Noisy Behavior and Risk-Based Alerting with ATT&amp;CK</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Tracking Noisy Behavior and Risk-Based Alerting with ATT&amp;CK for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdic9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdic9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdic9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdic9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdic9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MITREATTACK">MITRE ATT&amp;CK</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">From ATT&amp;CKcon 3.0

By Haylee Mills, Splunk

Having ATT&amp;CK to identify threats, prioritize data sources, and improve security posture has been a huge step forward for our industry, but how do we actualize those insights for better detection and alerting? By shifting to observations of behavior over one-to-one direct alerts, noisy datasets become valuable treasure troves with ATT&amp;CK metadata. Additionally, we can begin to look at detection and threat hunting on behavior instead of users or systems. In this presentation, Haylee will discuss the shift in mindset and the nuts and bolts of detections that leverage this metadata in Splunk, but the concept can be applied with custom tools to any valuable security dataset.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ic9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ic9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-18" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1jc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R1jc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1jc9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/open-source-intelligencefestivalict2014/41794132"><span class="sr-only">Open Source Intelligence (OSINT)</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:18" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Open Source Intelligence (OSINT)</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdjc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdjc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdjc9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdjc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdjc9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ICTfestival">festival ICT 2016</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Durante l’intervento verranno presentati i cardini del processo di ricerca delle informazioni mediante la consultazione di fonti di pubblico accesso. Sarà illustrata la teoria alla base di questo processo che prevede l’identificazione delle fonti, la selezione e la valutazione del loro contenuto informativo per arrivare infine all’utilizzo stesso dell’informazione estratta. Nella seconda fase della presentazione verranno mostrati i tool e le metodologie per l’estrazione di informazioni mediante l’analisi di documenti, foto, social network e altre fonti spesso trascurate. In ultimo saranno mostrati sistemi in grado di correlare diverse informazioni provenienti dalle fonti aperte e verranno discussi i relativi scenari di utilizzo nonché le possibili contromisure.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1jc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1jc9jnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-19" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1kc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":R1kc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1kc9jnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/mitre-attckcon-20-using-threat-intelligence-to-focus-attck-activities-david-westin-and-andy-kettell-nationwide/193702807"><span class="sr-only">MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon 2.0: Using Threat Intelligence to Focus ATT&amp;CK Activities; Da...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:19" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon 2.0: Using Threat Intelligence to Focus ATT&amp;CK Activities; Da..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/mitreattckcon2019usingthreatintelligencetofocuskettelwestinnationwide-191114214149-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon 2.0: Using Threat Intelligence to Focus ATT&amp;CK Activities; Da..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/mitreattckcon2019usingthreatintelligencetofocuskettelwestinnationwide-191114214149-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon 2.0: Using Threat Intelligence to Focus ATT&amp;CK Activities; Da...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save MITRE ATT&amp;CKcon 2.0: Using Threat Intelligence to Focus ATT&amp;CK Activities; Da... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdkc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdkc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdkc9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdkc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdkc9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/attackcon2018">MITRE - ATT&amp;CKcon</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses Nationwide&#x27;s experience using threat intelligence to focus their MITRE ATT&amp;CK activities. Their initial broad approach analyzing 240+ techniques at once was unsuccessful. They then prioritized techniques based on threats to the financial sector. This focused their efforts on the 27 most relevant threat actors and the 100+ techniques associated with them. They mapped techniques to the ATT&amp;CK matrix and conducted intelligence research. This intelligence-led approach improved their security posture understanding and enabled prioritized, actionable recommendations. The process is ongoing to constantly evolve their defenses based on the latest intelligence.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1kc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1kc9jnf6"></div></div><div class="desktop-recs"><div class="Slider_root__c0Jo8"><div class="Slider_scroller__KHjw4"><div class="BottomRecommendationCard_root__gffTk RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes a CrowdStrike webinar on detecting advanced malware-free intrusions. It describes three speakers from CrowdStrike - Dmitri Alperovitch, Chris Scott, and Adam Meyers. The webinar then discusses how adversaries like China and various state-sponsored and criminal groups are adapting their tactics to evade detection, and how security teams must also adapt detection methods to focus on real-time monitoring rather than indicators of compromise. The webinar includes a case study of detecting a webshell attack in near real-time using CrowdStrike Falcon Host and concludes with a demonstration of its endpoint protection capabilities.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R11cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R11cajnf6"></div><div class="separator class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">In today’s threat environment, adversaries are constantly profiling and attacking your corporate infrastructure to access and collect your intellectual property, proprietary data, and trade secrets. Now, more than ever, Threat Intelligence is increasingly important for organizations who want to proactively defend against advanced threat actors.

While many organizations today are collecting massive amount of threat intelligence, are they able to translate the information into an effective defense strategy?

View the slides now to learn about threat intelligence for operational purposes, including real-world demonstrations of how to consume intelligence and integrate it with existing security infrastructure.

Learn how to prioritize response by differentiating between commodity and targeted attacks and develop a defense that responds to specific methods used by advanced attackers.</span></div></div><div data-cy="slideshow-title">Cyber Security Emerging Threats</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Cyber Security Emerging Threats for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/isc2dfw">isc2dfw</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Michael Saylor is the executive director of Cyber Defense Labs at UT Dallas. The document discusses current cyber security trends and emerging threats. Recent trends in 2013 included an increase in attacks with web and social engineering components as well as politically motivated DDoS attacks. Mobile devices and applications are increasingly being targeted, as are advanced persistent threats from groups like China&#x27;s APT1. Emerging threats discussed include the potential for increased cyber crime and terrorism from groups funded by drug cartels and foreign states. The document recommends best practices for organizations like user education, monitoring, encryption, and frequent security assessments.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R13cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R13cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">The Evolution of Advanced Persistent Threats_The Current Risks and Mitigation...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save The Evolution of Advanced Persistent Threats_The Current Risks and Mitigation... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd4cajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd4cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd4cajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd4cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd4cajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/LumensionSecurity">Lumension</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">APTs have become a major topic of conversation – and in some cases, a critical threat – among IT security departments. But the technology and motivation behind APTs has changed significantly since the introduction of Stuxnet, continuing to evolve rapidly to avoid detection. 
In this special Dark Reading presentation, a leading expert on the origins and directions of APTs will discuss the changing nature of these sophisticated threats – and how you can prepare your enterprise security environment to detect and mitigate these complex and dangerous attacks.

RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The FBI is tasked with protecting the US from cyber threats including cybercrime, espionage, and terrorism. The document outlines various cyber threats such as phishing schemes, botnets, and malware infections. It also describes the FBI&#x27;s response which includes investigating cases, sharing intelligence through task forces and information portals, and advising but not directly assisting victims. International cooperation is needed to address cyber threats effectively.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R16cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R16cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-6" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R17cajnf6:" popovertarget=":R17cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R17cajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/trend-micro-is-your-cloud-secure/16776407"><span class="sr-only">Trend Micro - is your cloud secure</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Trend Micro - is your cloud secure for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd7cajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd7cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd7cajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd7cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd7cajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Kappadata">Kappa Data </a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses the need for organizations to have a smart protection strategy to secure their cloud environments from cyber threats. It notes that threats are becoming more challenging due to trends like cloud/virtualization, consumerization, and the actions of employees. An effective strategy uses global threat intelligence from multiple sources to detect both known and unknown threats. It advocates for network-wide detection, custom sandboxes for analysis, and automated security updates. The strategy aims to provide advanced, targeted protection while remaining simple to manage and deploy.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R17cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R17cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">KASPERSKY SECURITY BULLETIN 2013</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd8cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd8cajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Kappadata">Kappa Data </a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Once again, it’s time for Kaspersky to deliver our customary retrospective of the key events that have defined the threat landscape in 2013. Let’s start by looking back at the things we thought would shape the year ahead, based on the trends we observed in the previous year. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":R18cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R18cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-8" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R19cajnf6:" popovertarget=":R19cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R19cajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/cb19-from-advanced-persistent-threats-to-advanced-persistent-manipulators-the-evolving-cyber-defense-battlefield-by-mei-nelson/204343930"><span class="sr-only">[CB19] From Advanced Persistent Threats to &quot;Advanced Persistent Manipulators&quot;...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:8" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="[CB19] From Advanced Persistent Threats to &quot;Advanced Persistent Manipulators&quot;..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/idefensemeinelsoncodeblue19slidedeck20191125public-191211072501-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="[CB19] From Advanced Persistent Threats to &quot;Advanced Persistent Manipulators&quot;..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/idefensemeinelsoncodeblue19slidedeck20191125public-191211072501-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">[CB19] From Advanced Persistent Threats to &quot;Advanced Persistent Manipulators&quot;...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save [CB19] From Advanced Persistent Threats to &quot;Advanced Persistent Manipulators&quot;... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd9cajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd9cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd9cajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd9cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd9cajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/codeblue_jp">CODE BLUE</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">As advanced persistent threats (APTs) have become pervasive, governments and organizations have spent billions of dollars over the years fighting them. Meanwhile, actors have created a new breed of threat – “Advanced Persistent Manipulators” (APMs), to borrow a term coined by scholar Clint Watts at the Alliance for Securing Democracy in the United States. APMs have learned from APTs’ successes and taken advantage of the developments in information technology with an aim of manipulating information and influencing decision making.
This presentation will explore Advanced Persistent Manipulator threats through a comparative study with advanced persistent threats. This comparison will examine motives, goals, and tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) related to each. It will further review the unique characteristics of APMs and current regulatory environments that affect efforts to defend against disinformation. Lastly, this presentation will offer countermeasures that governments and private organizations may want to consider when developing plans for defense against APM threats in the current and evolving threat environment.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R19cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R19cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1acajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1acajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1acajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/netscout-threat-report-2018/109428518"><span class="sr-only">Netscout threat report 2018</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Netscout threat report 2018" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/netscoutthreatreportfinal080618b-180810233330-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Netscout threat report 2018" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/netscoutthreatreportfinal080618b-180810233330-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Netscout threat report 2018</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Netscout threat report 2018 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdacajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdacajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdacajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdacajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdacajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/BogaelTech">Gabe Akisanmi</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">NETSCOUT Arbor released its 2018 NETSCOUT Threat Intelligence Report offering globally scoped internet threat intelligence together with the analysis of our security research organization. The report covers the latest trends and activities from nation-state advanced persistent threat (APT) groups, crimeware operations and Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack campaigns.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1acajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1acajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-10" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1bcajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1bcajnf6:" data-cy="slideshow-title">Cyber Conflict</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdbcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdbcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/tony.ridley">Enterprise Security Risk Management</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses how individuals and organizations can become unintended targets in cyber conflicts. It notes that cyber attacks often follow physical protests and tensions between countries. It provides tips on how to identify potential targeting through monitoring related physical protests, cyber attacks against similar organizations, and controversial business decisions. The document also categorizes different types of targets and their likelihood of facing short or long-term attacks. It closes by questioning if standard cyber defenses are sufficient against sophisticated, persistent threats.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1bcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1bcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/JoshuaLawtonMBA">Joshua Lawton, MBA</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses international cooperative efforts to hunt advanced persistent threats (APTs). It begins with introductions from two experts in the field and then provides information on what APTs are, realities of interacting with them, processes for target selection and interdiction, and examples of prior takedowns. The key points are that APTs are sophisticated threats that pursue objectives over long periods of time, interacting with them requires careful consideration of potential escalation, and efforts to disrupt APT operations are an ongoing challenge as the actors adapt and find new ways to achieve their goals.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ccajnf6:" popover="auto" https://videocon-servicecenterinmumbai.com/</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1dcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1dcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-13" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ecajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1ecajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ecajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bsides-san-diego-2017-sophisticuffs-the-rumble-over-adversary-sophistication/71073743"><span class="sr-only">BSides San Diego 2017 - Sophisticuffs: The rumble over adversary sophistication</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:13" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BSides San Diego 2017 - Sophisticuffs: The rumble over adversary sophistication" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/bsidessd2017sophisticuffs-170116203544-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BSides San Diego 2017 - Sophisticuffs: The rumble over adversary sophistication" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/bsidessd2017sophisticuffs-170116203544-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BSides San Diego 2017 - Sophisticuffs: The rumble over adversary sophistication</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BSides San Diego 2017 - Sophisticuffs: The rumble over adversary sophistication for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdecajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdecajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdecajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdecajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdecajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/PalJaramillo">Paül Jaramillo</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">It has been a reoccurring theme for corporate victims of a major breach to publicly state that the attack perpetrated on them was sophisticated. Some may even go so far as to have their 3rd party DFIR partner(s) make statements on their behalf to the effect that the attack would have been successful at most companies. All this is done in an attempt to avoid the dreaded assumption of IT Security negligence on their part. Imagine if the press release stated that the attack might have been thwarted if they implemented processes and controls that were recommended by internal staff years ago.
While we will never read that statement, many practitioners are left to wonder what was so unique and advanced about this attack. With this presentation we will present analysis of existing public attacks against traits that are more common in truly advanced attacks. These include but are not limited to the ability to operate undetected, precise targeting, use of non-public zero days and custom payloads, ability to defeat in place security controls, strong operational security, speed and of course overall effectiveness. We will also make clear delineations between what constitutes and advanced attack versus an advanced adversary. The output of this will be a model that can be applied to help characterize your adversaries capabilities.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ecajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ecajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1fcajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1fcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1fcajnf6"><a Theatre</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:14" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save The Art of Cyber War:  Cyber Security Strategies in a Rapidly Evolving Theatre for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdfcajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdfcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdfcajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdfcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdfcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Radware">Radware</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Is the world in the midst of a cyber-war? If so, what are the implications?

In this presentation Carl Herberger, Radware&#x27;s VP of Security Solutions, explores some of the most notable recent cyber-attacks and how many of the findings correlate with the tenets of warfare as defined in The Art of War by Sun Tzu, the ancient military general, strategist and tactician. 

How should organizations be preparing for an information security landscape that is shaped by ideologically motivated cyber warfare rather than just opportunistic cyber-crime? Learn the techniques being employed to safeguard IT operations in a theatre that is witnessing ever more sophisticated attacks.

For more on how to help detect, mitigate and win this cyber war battle, visit here: http://www.radware.com/ert-report-2013/ to download the 2013 Global Application and Network Security Report.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1fcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1fcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf Threats </span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Real World Defense Strategies for Targeted Endpoint Threats </span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Threats  for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdgcajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdgcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdgcajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdgcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdgcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/LumensionSecurity">Lumension</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses strategies for defending against targeted endpoint threats such as advanced persistent threats (APTs). It begins with an overview of APTs and examines targeted threat trends, including that most attacks target user devices and organizations of all sizes. It then presents a targeted threat framework involving discover, distribute, exploit, control, and execute phases. The document advocates a defense-in-depth strategy using tools like antivirus, firewalls, and patch management to detect, deny, disrupt, and defend against targeted threats throughout the attack lifecycle. It concludes with additional resources on educating users and security professionals about APTs and defense best practices.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1gcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1gcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1hcajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1hcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1hcajnf6"><a Program</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a
